column2: Arabidopsis thaliana
Least Concern
Small stature, rapid life cycle, abundant seeds
Interacts with hormones, proteins, and environmental factors
Involved in photosynthesis, metabolism, and signaling
Regulated by transcription factors, enhancers, and silencers
Located on five chromosomes with occasional inversions
Modified by DNA methylation, histone modifications, and small RNA
Contains a circular mitochondrial genome and a linear chloroplast genome
Found worldwide in various habitats
Involved in various protein complexes for cellular processes
Exhibits differential expression in diverse environments
Gorilla gorilla
Critically Endangered
Large body size, strong social bonds, tool use
Interacts with pathogens, conspecifics, and abiotic factors
Involved in immune response, metabolism, and communication
Regulated by non-coding RNAs, transcription factors, and epigenetic modifications
Located on 24 chromosomes with occasional translocations
Modified by DNA methylation, histone modifications, and higher-order chromatin structures
Contains circular mitochondrial and chloroplast genomes with reduced functionality
Restricted to dense forests in Central Africa
Involved in various protein complexes for brain function and muscle development
Exhibits differential expression in response to environmental changes
Escherichia coli
Least Concern (non-pathogenic strains)
Versatile metabolism, motility, biofilm formation
Interacts with nutrients, signaling molecules, and other microbes
Involved in central metabolism, amino acid biosynthesis, and stress response
Regulated by sigma factors, transcription factors, and small RNA molecules
Located on a circular chromosome with occasional plasmids
Modified by DNA methylation, phase-variable genes, and restriction-modification systems
Contains a circular mitochondrial genome (only in aerobic strains)
Found worldwide in diverse environments
Involved in various protein complexes for motility, DNA replication, and transcription
Exhibits differential expression in response to environmental stimuli
Drosophila melanogaster
Small size, short lifespan, abundant offspring
Interacts with food, mates, and pathogens
Involved in development, reproduction, and stress response
Regulated by non-coding RNAs, transcription factors, and epigenetic marks
Located on four chromosomes with occasional inversions and translocations
Contains a circular mitochondrial genome with reduced functionality
Worldwide distribution in various habitats
Involved in various protein complexes for neural function and development
Exhibits differential expression in response to environmental cues
Panthera leo
Vulnerable
Large body size, social hierarchy, territoriality
Interacts with prey, conspecifics, and abiotic factors
Located on 18 chromosomes with occasional variations
Restricted to sub-Saharan Africa and a small portion of India
Involved in various protein complexes for muscle development and neural function
Bos taurus
Domesticated
Large body size, gregarious, used for meat, milk, and labor
Interacts with humans, feed, and pathogens
Involved in metabolism, growth, reproduction, and immune response
Located on 30 chromosomes with occasional variations
Involved in various protein complexes for muscle development and milk production
Caenorhabditis elegans
Small size, self-fertilizing hermaphrodites, short lifespan
Located on six chromosomes with occasional variations
Canis lupus familiaris
Various sizes and shapes, used for companionship, hunting, and herding
Interacts with humans, food, and pathogens
Located on 38 chromosomes with occasional variations
Involved in various protein complexes for muscle development, neural function, and sensory perception
Populus tremuloides
Deciduous tree, fast-growing, extensive root system
Interacts with sunlight, water, soil, and pathogens
Involved in photosynthesis, metabolism, and stress response
Located on 19 chromosomes with occasional variations
Contains a circular mitochondrial genome and a circular chloroplast genome
Native to North America in various habitats
Involved in various protein complexes for wood formation and defense response
Danio rerio
Small size, egg-laying, used as model organism
Located on 25 chromosomes with occasional variations
Native to Southeast Asia in various aquatic habitats
